Package com.android

  • Class Summary
    Class Description
    Animal
    Animal classes that will be used to create Streams of Animals
    Badger
    Badger class for Usage with Streams.
    Examples
    for video click on these examples will introduce us to Streams and to TERMINAL operations, Terminal operations cause the creation and intermediate operations to run, but they will not run UNTIL there is a Terminal operation in your Stream List of TERMINAL OPERATIONS toArray() see Examples.ex8() collect() see Examples.ex10() count() see Examples.ex5() reduce() see Examples.ex10() forEach() see Examples.ex9() forEachOrdered() see Examples.ex9() min() see Examples.ex5() max() see Examples.ex5() anyMatch() see Examples.ex7() allMatch() see Examples.ex7() noneMatch() see Examples.ex7() findAny() see Examples.ex6() findFirst() see Examples.ex6() collect() see Examples.ex11() terminal operations CANNOT be chained we also cover some Stream creation operation which are create() see Examples.ex2() iterate() see Examples.ex3() This class has methods that deal with Introduction Java 8 Steams, Java 8 streams operate on the principle of CHAINED methods.
    Main  
    Rat
    Rat class for usuage with streams, specifically using Max() and Min() methods of the Stream Examples.ex5() and has use them to create HashSet, which will then be used to create streams.
